00027 /* standard includes. */
00028 #include <stdio.h>
00029 
00030 /* basic includes. */
00031 #include "gfs-typedefs.h"
00032 #include "gfs-input-files-list.h"
00033 
00034 /* function prototypes. */
00035 INPUT_FILES *parse_input_files (INPUT_FILES * listp, cint argc, char *argv[]);
00036 
00037 /* functions. */
00038 
00056 INPUT_FILES *
00057 parse_input_files (INPUT_FILES * listp, cint argc, char *argv[])
00058 {
00059   /* externs. */
00060 
00061   /* function externs. */
00062   extern INPUT_FILE *new_input_file (const char *);
00063   extern INPUT_FILE *add_input_file (INPUT_FILE *, INPUT_FILE *);
00064   extern BOOL input_file_exists (INPUT_FILES *, cstring);
00065   extern FILE_INFO check_input_file (cstring);
00066 
00067   /* variable externs. */
00068 
00069   /* starting input files position. */
00070   extern int optind;
00071 
00072   /* if there are possible input files check them. */
00073   if (argc > optind)
00074     {
00075       /* is used for the loop. */
00076       register int i;
00077 
00078       /* parse possible input files (accept only
00079          regular ascii files and add them to the
00080          list. */
00081       for (i = optind; i < argc; i++)
00082         if (!input_file_exists (listp, argv[i]))
00083           if (check_input_file (argv[i]) == f_accessible)
00084             listp = add_input_file (listp, new_input_file (argv[i]));
00085     }
00086 
00087   /* return the input files list. */
00088   return listp;
00089 }
